Reviews.Title: “Clean Place! Friendly Staff!! Perfect Location...”
Reviews.Author: AhmedDin
Reviews.Content: Hi we were four fireinds visiting dubai for first time... we booked this hotel and were very much satisfied of this hotel. We booked an appartment with two rooms, one king size bed and other room with two twins. There was also a sitting area and kitchen. Room were very clean. Location was just perfect for a tourist. Hardly 2 min walk and you are into Mall of Emirates entrance gate 1 (near east food court). This mall has also Metro station. Breakfast was good too... Pelase note Wifi is not free and you have to pay for it. I guess 25 Dharams for full day ( not sure). Staff was very friendly You can discount coupons for safari and wild wadi from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Beatlemania216
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel apartment is that you will find it difficult to find a better price with its standard and location. The Emirates Mall is only 5 minutes by walk and Burj Al Arab is 20 minutes by taxi. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly but could have been more helpful. At one time we needed a taxi there and then but they couldnt help us out because their commissioned taxi company was busy. If you dont book your taxi at least a day before, better go and wait for one in the taxi queue at the mall

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave740
Reviews.Content: Found the apartment clean and it was cleaned on a daily basis.Staff were always polite and found the appartment value for money.Easy walking distance to Mall of Emirates and Metro.Stayed from December 27th to January 2nd.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: SAT33
Reviews.Content: As I work in Dubai I was looking for an apartment to stay. I like to stay in hotel apartments so I found that hotel in the internet. After a few complications we could talk tot the manager about taking an apartment for a year. We verbally agreed on a rate and I paid the first month upfront. About one week before that month was over my wife asked the staff how we can pay the next month. The staff then came back to us and told us we can't stay to the agreed price and have to pay 1,000 AED more. Of course we then moved to somewhere else as this is an outrage. To do business like that is not acceptable and I am disappointed about them. The rooms are not bad (not that big but fully equipped) and the location is excellent right next to the MOE. But the service is below standard (Mr. Froy from reception is arrogant and only if he has a good mood he is talking to customers). Overall I can't recommend this hotel to anyone and only warn you to make business with tem.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Value for money - terrible breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: katie_emma_reeves
Reviews.Content: Najd Hotel is a mixture of very friendly service, good location close to Mall of the Emirates, well-equipped kitchen, good free baby cots and relatively cheap for Dubai. However, the negatives do not overcome the positives therefore I would not stay there again. The room was not fully ready when we arrived and we did say we could just drop bags and come back - we went into the room and it was not totally clean. The bathroom became smelly after the four days, we could hear the floor above us move chairs, the TV etc. There is a noisy building site with constant drilling or generator behind the hotel - get a front room. The breakfasts are inedible - sorry I like warm brown toast. The wifi internet not being free is not acceptable having travelled a lot this has been included in several other similar establishments of similar price and better quality. So Najd is a place of contrasts bit like Dubai and if you are not fussy stay here - but I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “from bad to worse”
Reviews.Author: peteraquilla
Reviews.Content: on our third stay here,our room requested was not available so had to take a side apartment,this was opposite the next door hotel,too close for comfort,the room itself was ok,pool was closed,kitchen equipment was not up to standard,shower was very slow and a trickle, lacked pressure,if you turned the shower head to wash nether regions the water stopped all together,not happy with the room so later in the week was allocated another room,oh no.....this was even worse....kitchen cooker was dirty,no lamps in the lounge area,small bathroom not able to use,on closing the door the ceiling collapsed,the main bathroom towels were not very clean......won't be staying here again..if it is third time lucky....sorry not at the najd......the staff are brilliant,nothing is too much trouble......great team.....but the actual hotel/apartments.......no,this has to be " the house that jack built"...needs a complete refurbishment....

Reviews.Title: “Basic - and old”
Reviews.Author: Samkins
Reviews.Content: In a city like Dubai, I found the hotel to be a very basic one as best. Very limited number of service staff (2-3 people on duty at one time!). Breakfast options limited and get delivered to the room. The hotel/apartments have no restaurants of its own. The toiletries, the bathroom, and bedding everything is very old and dated. Things I noticed: - bedside lamps not connected to any plugs and do not even have sockets close by to connect - tea/coffee do not get refilled till you ask for it - although hotel was emply courtesies like early check in and late check out were not extended (upon request) - daily cleaning for room - very basic The location is good - because it is five minutes walk from Mall of Emirates and 10 minutes from the MOE metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for money”
Reviews.Author: KiwiPaula
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at Najd in November. At that time I was impressed. This time, the tariff was an additional 50% (AED 600 per night, 2 bedroom), due to Easter I suppose. Boy, did I feel a bit ripped off. There are definitely better options in that price range. I would not stay at Najd again for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and handy stay right near Mall of Emirates”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners160110
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night stop over on our honeymoon in March. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had a view of the Mall of Emirates and Ski Dubai. Our room had a kitchen, living room, 2 toilets and a bathroom, washing machine and a television. Breakfast was served to our room, always within 10 minutes of ringing up to order it. It was a 3 minute walk to the door of Mall of the Emirates and 10 minutes to the new train system. There are no restaurants on the streets in Dubai like other countries so we found buying some food at Carrefour and cooking it back at the unit was fun. The rooftop pool was nice and clean. There are lots of cranes and construction work happening all over Dubai so there was not much privacy on the roof top. The staff would order us a taxi when we needed it and they offered a free shuttle to the beach at 10.30am which we used once.

Reviews.Title: “good,but lacking maintenance”
Reviews.Author: peteraquilla
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here last october and enjoyed the whole package,room,staff,locality all great so decided to stay again even asked for the same room..oh that was a mistake,the broken curtain rail that I had reported in October was still broken,the cooker which I had cleaned last October was again filthy and greasy..it appears that housekeeping just don't clean cookers/ovens and extractor fans...the kitchen unit doors were hanging off,they were repaired when I complained,only a couple or three screws but hey,who takes a screwdriver on vacation? still lots of work and construction going on around the Nadj,crane drivers/operators overlooking the rooftop pool...but a clean hotel,great staff,nice welcome and great location 2 minute walk to Mall of the Emirates and the Metro system....will hopefully stay here again but will remember to take rubber gloves,oven cleaner and a tool kit !!!! was promised by night manager Mohammed that all will be ok for our next visit in Ocober.....we shall see,we are not holding our breath..but seriously it is a great hotel and great views of the Burj Khalifa,burj Dubai and the big expensive hotel on Palm Island ( ? ) from the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: KiwiPaula
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with Najd. Close enough to walk to Mall of the Emirates. The staff were accommodating. The apartments were clean and reasonably well appointed. The beds and linen were good quality and crispy clean - just the way I like. We have stayed at Golden Sands 10 a few times, but I prefer Najd for standard, cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, nice clean rooms, friendly staff, but a bit hard to find.”
Reviews.Author: henke7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Najd for 4 nights, Nov 09, in a double room apartment, which was really comfortable with a nice bedroom, toilet/washroom, lounge area and a well equipped kitchen. Traditional furnishings throughout the hotel which are bright, clean and pleasant. Roof top pool is good, although only 4 loungers and mostly construction views. Nice gym too. Staff are really nice and helpful. I paid £65 a night, incl breakfast, which I thought was really good value for Dubai. It would have been same price even for 2 people. A couple of times I asked for bottled water and there was no charge. There is a little supermarket, turn right out of hotel and about 150 yds on left had side. The only downsides (and they weren't showstoppers) were: 1) the huge amount of contsruction going on around the hotel, 2) apart from Mall of Emirates, there wasn't much within walking distance to do or see, 3) taxis don't know where the hotel is and keep getting lost - on this point, make sure and get a location map from the hotel to show taxi drivers. Things that were good in Dubai: 1. the Atlantis Hotel, especially the Aquaventure Waterpark (and try the new monorail - you can get on at the Atlantis and do a return journey over the 3 stops, which allows you to see the hotel from a great angle on the return journey - takes about 45mins all in. 2. Mall of The Emirates - if you like shopping 3. Trader Vics , restuarant at the Madinat Jumeriah ( a marina, Souk and food place all in one - really nice) 4. La Veranda restauarnt in grounds of Palm Jumeriah hotel. Just walk through hotel lobby and out back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything needs to be clarified with them before you go”
Reviews.Author: findnsecure
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family for GITEX in Oct'09. They promised free internet but on enquiry they said signals are available freely but you have to pay to use them !!! After lot of discussion they relented. Free shuttle to exhibition grounds was included but as per them free shuttle means only drop. Pickup is chargeable !!! Discounts to Wild wadi were included but on enquiry they said the discount coupons are finished. The furnished apartments were good but the kitchen had few utensils. Lot of construction area going on in the vicinity and hence lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “good price, central location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: arcana00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Najd with a friend for 2 nights. It was really close to the Mall of Emirates. Just 5 mins walk away. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable with a small bathroom, kitchen and lounge. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a pool and sauna which is free to use however I din't have time to try. The only handicap was the ongoing constructions around the hotel. Actually, in Dubai it is full of constructions everywhere. The district was very safe to go out at night etc. I'd recommend this place for anyone who is planing a short stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Najd Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayed Road, Al Barsha | P.O. Box 214671, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
